discoveredAssets: localhost - IP address (127.0.0.1) - No domain configuration found
localhost:80 - HTTP service (OFFLINE) - Target specified but port not listening - Connection refused
localhost:2280 - HTTP service (daytona process) - All endpoints return 404 Not Found
localhost:22220 - Infrastructure service (daytona process) - TCP listener responding with HTTP/0.9 protocol
localhost:22222 - Web Terminal Application (xterm.js-based) - Daytona process
localhost:22222 - / - Root HTML interface (200 OK) - Web terminal UI entry point
localhost:22222 - /xterm.css - Static CSS stylesheet (200 OK) - Terminal styling
localhost:22222 - /xterm.js - Static JavaScript library (200 OK) - Terminal emulator library
localhost:22222 - /xterm-addon-fit.js - Static JavaScript addon (200 OK) - Terminal responsive fitting
localhost:22222 - /ws - WebSocket endpoint (400 Bad Request via HTTP) - Terminal bidirectional communication

targets.objective: Comprehensive penetration testing of Web Terminal application including WebSocket protocol security, authentication and authorization mechanisms, XSS/injection vulnerabilities in terminal input, terminal command execution security, and information disclosure through terminal output or application metadata.
targets.rationale: This is the primary interactive web application discovered. The Web Terminal provides command shell access through a web interface, making it a critical security target. The WebSocket endpoint (/ws) handles sensitive terminal communication. Requires testing for authentication bypass, WebSocket security vulnerabilities, command injection, and information leakage.

targets.objective: Security assessment of WebSocket endpoint including protocol security, message validation, input sanitization, rate limiting, and potential for denial of service or unauthorized command execution through WebSocket messages.
targets.rationale: The /ws endpoint is the critical component enabling the terminal functionality. Requires specific WebSocket security testing including protocol validation, message handling, and potential for command injection or privilege escalation through WebSocket communication.

targets.objective: Identification and analysis of the service running on port 22220. Determine protocol implementation, service functionality, and potential security vulnerabilities. Test for command injection, protocol exploitation, and information disclosure.
targets.rationale: Unknown service responding to TCP connections with HTTP/0.9 protocol. Requires investigation to understand its functionality and security posture. May represent an undocumented or legacy interface requiring security assessment.

targets.objective: Enumerate endpoints and functionality on port 2280. Test for hidden endpoints, application logic, API discovery, and any actual content that may exist despite 404 responses on tested paths. Test various HTTP methods and request formats.
targets.rationale: Port 2280 returns 404 for all tested endpoints but may have specific endpoints not discovered during initial enumeration. Requires thorough endpoint discovery and testing of various HTTP methods and request patterns to identify any actual functionality.

keyFindings: [CRITICAL] Target http://localhost:80 specified in scope is NOT RESPONDING. Port 80 is not listening on localhost. Connection refused.
[CRITICAL] Web Terminal application exposes WebSocket endpoint (/ws) on port 22222 enabling direct shell command execution through web interface
[HIGH] Web Terminal provides browser-based terminal access with xterm.js library - potential for XSS/injection if input not properly sanitized
[HIGH] Unknown service on port 22220 responding with HTTP/0.9 protocol - purpose and security posture unclear, requires investigation
[MEDIUM] Port 2280 returns 404 for all endpoints but service is actively listening - may have specific routing or hidden functionality
[MEDIUM] Multiple ports (22220, 22222, 2280) all running from same daytona process - suggests multi-service application architecture
[INFO] Web application using xterm.js library version/details not disclosed - may contain known vulnerabilities depending on version
